title: New to Pixel & Google UI, Need better understanding of Hands Free
content:
I'm coming from Windows 10 Mobile with Cortana.  I felt that hands free worked well with Cortana because I always got a verbal response to everything, specifically reading and sending texts while driving, which kept my eyes off of the phone.  I have adjusted all settings I could but Google assistant does not always verbally confirm!

I received an email today, "Apps to Help Me Communicate".  Two of those Apps are Google Text-to-Speech and Voice Access.  Now, wouldn't those two apps already be in use within Google Assistant during hands free?  Should I download them?  How do they interface with other Apps?  Will they make "Hey Google" work better during hands free?

I have been thinking about installing Cortana; I like Microsoft and have had success with Cortana, but if I can get native software to work, I would prefer that!  Also, I do not have an interface to any of my vehicles so the Google software for driving will not work.

Thanks for any help
